content.description: Follow the seam up and to the right as it passes a streak of white rock.
content.protection: Protect the seam with a standard rack. There is one bolt at the bottom and one at the top. Chains.
content.location: This is the last route on the wall.

content.description: Climb on big holds before a tricky step up and right at the third bolt. Finish on mellow climbing to a good stance with the anchor.
content.location:
It is just right of the corner and the route,

First Steps

.

climbs.name: Sugar Coated Flake
climbs.fa: T. Perkins, K. Davis, D. Ranck

content.description: Climb the face to the right of the large dihedral.  A relatively large roof for the grade greets you at mid-route.
content.protection:
4 bolts, it shares anchors with

The Passifyer

.
content.location: Start just left of a crack that arches up and to the right at a very low angle.

content.description:
Head up the juggy dihedral with a couple of fun arete moves at the top of the crack.  Afterward, move right toward the anchors of

Sugar Coated Flake

.
content.protection:
Standard rack. Clip last bolt of

Sugar Coated Flake

.
content.location: This is the dihedral at the far left end of the wall.

content.description: This is a juggy route with big ledges.  It is a nice lead for the novice with bomber stances for clipping.
content.location: This is just left of center.

content.description: This climb moves over a variety of angles on black rock.  After a short overhang off the ground, a series of crimps gets you past the fun slab at mid route.
content.protection:
4 bolts, it shares anchors with

The Passifyer

.
content.location: Begin near the center of a long crack that arches at a low angle up and to the right.

climbs.name: Count Chalkula
climbs.fa: D. Ranck, T. Perkins, K. Davis

content.description: This is the route furthest to the left.  After a slightly overhanging start, stemming and jugs get you to the slab above.
